title: Orgeat Recipe
full_text:
Orgeat Recipe
Close
Jump to recipe
Prep
10 mins
Cook
10 mins
Active
15 mins
Infusing Time
3 hrs 10 mins
Total
3 hrs 30 mins
Serves
10 ounces
Makes
300 ml (1 1/4 cups)
Cook Mode
(Keep screen awake)
Ingredients
2
cups
raw almonds
, sliced or chopped
1 1/2
cups
sugar
1 1/4
cups
water
1
teaspoon
orange flower water
(see notes)
1
ounce
vodka
Directions
Toast almonds at 400°F (200°C) for 4 minutes, shaking after 2 minutes.
Serious Eats / Liz Clayman
Cool almonds and then pulverize them with a blender or food processor.
Serious Eats / Liz Clayman
In a saucepan, cook sugar and water on medium heat until sugar dissolves and the mixture starts to boil, about 3 minutes, stirring constantly.
Serious Eats / Liz Clayman
Add pulverized almonds and simmer on low heat, stirring frequently. When mixture is about to boil, remove from heat and cover. Let it sit for a minimum of 3 hours and no more than 12 hours.
Serious Eats / Liz Clayman
Strain steeped mixture through 3 layers of cheesecloth into a bowl, squeezing the cloth as you go.
Serious Eats / Liz Clayman
Add orange flower water and vodka, then stir. Funnel into a glass jar or bottle.
Serious Eats / Liz Clayman
Special Equipment
Blender
or
food processor
, cheesecloth
Notes
Store in the refrigerator, for no more than one month.
This orgeat is darker in color than some other recipes because the skins are left on the almonds. I like the richer color and extra almond flavor this adds. If you prefer a sweeter, milky-white orgeat, use blanched almonds. Since there are oils in almonds, the syrup will separate. Shake before each use.
Orange flower water can be found at some grocery stores and Mediterranean markets, as well as online.
Almonds
Cocktails
